column4: Hey, I'm building a kinda stereo machine, and although there are command line mp3 players, I want to have playlists, etc, so I figured I was going to install a window manager like XFce, I just wanted to ask the channel for suggestions or better ideas before I go ahead and do this
dont use xfce.
just have a script that starts X and xmms. maaaaaybe fluxbox. but you dont really need a WM
hmmm that's not a bad idea either.  I forgot about fluxbox
you want the thinnest wm possible if anything :)
how is xmms at things like playlists, library organization, basically, I'm looking for winamp for Linux.  I am also awaiting "SongBird" and am hoping that will be cross platform like Firefox
XMMS is great for playlists. its also non-DE specific like amarok and rhythmbox
beep media player is a bit better looking tho.
also, xmms and bmp both support winamp classic skins. not the modern ones tho :(
